intro: Pedilonum longicalcaratum, commonly known as the long-spurred pedilonum, is a striking member of the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its elongated, spurred petals that give it its scientific name. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded, moist environments. Its flowers are usually brightly colored, ranging from yellow to orange, which helps attract pollinators. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts interested in rare orchids.
